Description: Exterior marble angle-piece from a moulded band showing an egg and dart pattern. The angle egg is worked in profile on the corner, then inverted on each side. In the concave field a lotus blossom is preserved. The corner dart is located close to the edge and overlaid by a small hollow spiral. Next to the dart a sepal is preserved. The corner of the fragment consists of a hollow and pointy leaf whose midrib lies on the outer edge. On both sides of the rib, the lower part of buds is preserved. Traces of blue and red paint were found on the rebates of the front side. The fragment of light grey marble is broken off below the eggs. Its upper and back side is fractured.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: The reconstruction of this fragment bases on fragment B 411. Fragment resemblances the corner fragment to B 426, however, it is slightly different shaped. Published (Koenigs 2007, 330 Cat. 17; Petrie 1886, 14 No. 14, Pl. 14 No. 1 (14 A left below); Altekamp, 136ff. No. 1 Fig. 123 (with B413); Smith 1892; Lethaby, Gr. Buildings, fig. 197.)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B409)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIV, no. 1)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.17, p.330, pl. 17-19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.26) (Phase 3)
